metadata.title: CVE-2017-5611 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
SQL injection vulnerability in wp-includes/class-wp-query.php in WP_Query in WordPress before 4.7.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands by leveraging the presence of an affected plugin or theme that mishandles a crafted post type name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.7.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.7.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.7.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.7.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.7.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.7.2+dfsg-1').
